title: Awesome List Updates on Dec 15, 2022
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Dec 15, 2022 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Cybersecurity Blueteam
items.content_text:
### Operating System distributions / Firewall appliances or distributions

*   [Security Onion](https://securityonionsolutions.com/) - Free and open source GNU/Linux distribution for intrusion detection, enterprise security monitoring, and log management.

### Security monitoring / Network Security Monitoring (NSM)

*   [Arkime (‚≠ê6.7k)](https://github.com/arkime/arkime) - Augments your current security infrastructure to store and index network traffic in standard PCAP format, providing fast, indexed access.

### Transport-layer defenses / Overlay and Virtual Private Networks (VPNs)

*   [Firezone](https://www.firezone.dev/) - Self-hosted VPN server built on WireGuard that supports MFA and SSO.
items.content_html:
Operating System distributions / Firewall appliances or distributions

  • Security Onion - Free and open source GNU/Linux distribution for intrusion detection, enterprise security monitoring, and log management.

Security monitoring / Network Security Monitoring (NSM)

  • Arkime (‚≠ê6.7k) - Augments your current security infrastructure to store and index network traffic in standard PCAP format, providing fast, indexed access.

Transport-layer defenses / Overlay and Virtual Private Networks (VPNs)

  • Firezone - Self-hosted VPN server built on WireGuard that supports MFA and SSO.

items.title: Awesome Arcgis Developers
items.content_text:
### APIs and SDKs

*   [ArcGIS Maps SDK for Kotlin](https://developers.arcgis.com/kotlin/) - Guides, sample codes and API reference to build mobile apps using Kotlin.
*   [ArcGIS Maps SDK for Swift](https://developers.arcgis.com/swift/) - Guides, sample codes and API reference to build mobile apps using Swift.
items.content_html:
APIs and SDKs

  • ArcGIS Maps SDK for Kotlin - Guides, sample codes and API reference to build mobile apps using Kotlin.
  • ArcGIS Maps SDK for Swift - Guides, sample codes and API reference to build mobile apps using Swift.

### Web Frameworks

Web Frameworks

items.title: Awesome Generative Deep Art
items.content_text:
### Image Segmentation / Deforum

*   [Harmonai's Dance Diffusion](https://wandb.ai/wandb_gen/audio/reports/Harmonai-s-Dance-Diffusion-Open-Source-AI-Audio-Generation-Tool-For-Music-Producers--VmlldzoyNjkwOTM1): Open-Source AI Audio Generation Tool For Music Producers ‚Äì Weights & Biases
*   [Dance Diffusion](https://huggingface.co/spaces/harmonai/dance-diffusion): the Hugging Face Space by harmonai
*   [MubertAI/Mubert-Text-to-Music (‚≠ê2.7k)](https://github.com/MubertAI/Mubert-Text-to-Music): a simple notebook demonstrating prompt-based music generation via Mubert API
*   [DDSP-VST](https://magenta.tensorflow.org/ddsp-vst-blog): Neural Audio Synthesis for All
*   [LOVO AI](https://www.lovo.ai/): AI Voiceover & Text to Speech Platform with human-like voices
*   [AIVA](https://www.aiva.ai/): The AI composing emotional soundtrack music
*   [Jukebox](https://openai.com/blog/jukebox/): "a neural net that generates music, including rudimentary singing, as raw audio in a variety of genres and artist styles"
*   [Magenta](https://magenta.tensorflow.org/): Music and Art Generation with Machine Intelligence
*   [magenta/magenta (‚≠ê20k)](https://github.com/magenta/magenta): Magenta's official GitHub repository
*   [AI Image to sound \[Melobytes.com\]](https://melobytes.com/en/app/ai_image2sound)
*   [archinetai/audio-diffusion-pytorch (‚≠ê2.1k)](https://github.com/archinetai/audio-diffusion-pytorch): Audio generation using diffusion models, in PyTorch

### Artists and Artworks / Deforum

*   \[üî•] [Creep - YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c6LlG4g_9lk) by [Glenn Marshall Neural Art](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCes-tiSj7VO6nNOsUB76lZw): how did they translated the images using VQGAN+CLIP? How did they seamlessly wander on the latent space?
items.content_html:
Image Segmentation / Deforum

  • Harmonai's Dance Diffusion: Open-Source AI Audio Generation Tool For Music Producers ‚Äì Weights & Biases
  • Dance Diffusion: the Hugging Face Space by harmonai
  • MubertAI/Mubert-Text-to-Music (‚≠ê2.7k): a simple notebook demonstrating prompt-based music generation via Mubert API
  • DDSP-VST: Neural Audio Synthesis for All
  • LOVO AI: AI Voiceover & Text to Speech Platform with human-like voices
  • AIVA: The AI composing emotional soundtrack music
  • Jukebox: "a neural net that generates music, including rudimentary singing, as raw audio in a variety of genres and artist styles"
  • Magenta: Music and Art Generation with Machine Intelligence
  • magenta/magenta (‚≠ê20k): Magenta's official GitHub repository
  • AI Image to sound [Melobytes.com]
  • archinetai/audio-diffusion-pytorch (‚≠ê2.1k): Audio generation using diffusion models, in PyTorch

Artists and Artworks / Deforum

  • [üî•] Creep - YouTube by Glenn Marshall Neural Art: how did they translated the images using VQGAN+CLIP? How did they seamlessly wander on the latent space?

items.title: Awesome Food
items.content_text:
### Food-related projects

*   [RasPiBrew (‚≠ê190)](https://github.com/steve71/RasPiBrew) - Raspberry Pi Temperature Controller for homebrewing and sous vide cooking .

### Cookbooks

*   [El Fuego Viviente Chili Open Sauce (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/aweijnitz/recipe-el_fuego_viviente) - Fermented Chili "Open Sauce".
*   [Chowdown (‚≠ê636)](https://github.com/clarklab/chowdown) - A simple, plaintext markdown recipe database for hackers.
*   [Cooking-Recipes (‚≠ê31)](https://github.com/Donearm/Cooking-Recipes) - Mostly italian recipes.
*   [bagels (‚≠ê27)](https://github.com/andrewkern/bagels) - open source bagel recipe; let's raise the quality of bagels worldwide !

### Addresses

*   [awesome-kacchi (‚≠ê22)](https://github.com/s4kibs4mi/awesome-kacchi) - A curated list of awesome Kacchi Biryani available throughout the world.
*   [awesome-berlin (‚≠ê23)](https://github.com/AwesomeCities/awesome-berlin) - A curated list of Berlin's awesomeness.
*   [Berl√≠n para mexicanos (‚≠ê15)](https://github.com/carlosyslas/berlin-para-mexicanos) - Berlin guide for mexicans.
items.content_html:
Food-related projects

  • RasPiBrew (‚≠ê190) - Raspberry Pi Temperature Controller for homebrewing and sous vide cooking .

Cookbooks

  • El Fuego Viviente Chili Open Sauce (‚≠ê1.7k) - Fermented Chili "Open Sauce".
  • Chowdown (‚≠ê636) - A simple, plaintext markdown recipe database for hackers.
  • Cooking-Recipes (‚≠ê31) - Mostly italian recipes.
  • bagels (‚≠ê27) - open source bagel recipe; let's raise the quality of bagels worldwide !

Addresses

  • awesome-kacchi (‚≠ê22) - A curated list of awesome Kacchi Biryani available throughout the world.
  • awesome-berlin (‚≠ê23) - A curated list of Berlin's awesomeness.
  • Berl√≠n para mexicanos (‚≠ê15) - Berlin guide for mexicans.

items.title: Awesome Billing
items.content_text:
### Fraud / Online Payments

*   [Awesome Fraud Detection Research Papers (‚≠ê1.7k)](https://github.com/benedekrozemberczki/awesome-fraud-detection-papers) - Papers sourced from several conferences on all sort of fraud: credit card, payment transactions, loans, customs inspections, money laundering networks, and more.
items.content_html:
Fraud / Online Payments

  • Awesome Fraud Detection Research Papers (‚≠ê1.7k) - Papers sourced from several conferences on all sort of fraud: credit card, payment transactions, loans, customs inspections, money laundering networks, and more.

items.title: Awesome Bioinformatics
items.content_text:
### Bioinformatics on GitHub / Tools

*   [Awesome-alternative-splicing (‚≠ê56)](https://github.com/HussainAther/awesome-alternative-splicing) - List of resources on alternative splicing including software, databases, and other tools.
*   [Awesome AI-based Protein Design (‚≠ê260)](https://github.com/opendilab/awesome-AI-based-protein-design) - A collection of research papers for AI-based protein design.
items.content_html:
Bioinformatics on GitHub / Tools

  • Awesome AI-based Protein Design (‚≠ê260) - A collection of research papers for AI-based protein design.

items.title: Awesome Neovim
items.content_text:
### Project / Diagnostics

*   [nyngwang/suave.lua (‚≠ê69)](https://github.com/nyngwang/suave.lua) - Multi-tabs project session automation.

### Cursorline / Diagnostics

*   [nyngwang/murmur.lua (‚≠ê110)](https://github.com/nyngwang/murmur.lua) - Super-fast cursor word highlighting with callbacks(I call them murmurs) included.

### Utility / Diagnostics

*   [chrisgrieser/nvim-genghis (‚≠ê209)](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/nvim-genghis) - Convenience file operations, written in Lua.
*   [chrisgrieser/nvim-recorder (‚≠ê260)](https://github.com/chrisgrieser/nvim-recorder) - Simplifying and improving how you interact with macros.

### Terminal Integration / Diagnostics

*   [nyngwang/NeoTerm.lua (‚≠ê67)](https://github.com/nyngwang/NeoTerm.lua) - Attach a terminal for each **buffer**, now with stable toggle and astonishing cursor restoring.

### Quickfix / Diagnostics

*   [nyngwang/NeoWell.lua (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/nyngwang/NeoWell.lua) - Sometimes you will want to fix some lines later. Store lines into qf with some note so you know what to do when you really want to fix it.
items.content_html:
Project / Diagnostics

  • nyngwang/suave.lua (‚≠ê69) - Multi-tabs project session automation.

Cursorline / Diagnostics

  • nyngwang/murmur.lua (‚≠ê110) - Super-fast cursor word highlighting with callbacks(I call them murmurs) included.

Utility / Diagnostics

  • chrisgrieser/nvim-genghis (‚≠ê209) - Convenience file operations, written in Lua.
  • chrisgrieser/nvim-recorder (‚≠ê260) - Simplifying and improving how you interact with macros.

Terminal Integration / Diagnostics

  • nyngwang/NeoTerm.lua (‚≠ê67) - Attach a terminal for each buffer, now with stable toggle and astonishing cursor restoring.

Quickfix / Diagnostics

  • nyngwang/NeoWell.lua (‚≠ê14) - Sometimes you will want to fix some lines later. Store lines into qf with some note so you know what to do when you really want to fix it.
